page.title: 12ARBORFIELD TODAY (PART 2)
page.content:
THE OVER 60s CLUB WAS FORMED IN 1967 WITH 42 MEMBERS.TODAY,IN 1985,IT HAS OVER 50 MEMBERS.
THE ORIGINAL CHURCH WAS BUILT IN 1256 AND CALLED ST. BARTHOLOMEW'S, ALTHOUGH IT WAS LATER ADDED TO IN 1631.PARTS OF THIS CHURCH CAN STILL BE SEEN TODAY. THE NEW CHURCH BEGAN TO BE BUILT IN 1862 AND COST Â£4,000.THE CHURCH HAS 6 BELLS,5 OF WHICH CAME FROM THE ORIGINAL CHURCH.
THERE ARE ALSO TWO RIDING STABLES - "CLOVET" AND "CROSS LANES".
MANY PEOPLE WORK IN LONDON AND TRAVEL THERE EACH DAY BY TRAIN FROM WINNERSH STATION.
